newsitem.title: USA: Russian funds post strong gains on NYSE.
newsitem.headline: Russian funds post strong gains on NYSE.

text.p: Russian mutual funds gained strongly on the New York Stocks Exchange Wednesday, boosted by an inflow of money from investors, traders said.
"Overall there is a lot of money pouring into the market. The demand must be overwhelming," said a trader in Russian American Depositary Receipts.
The Templeton Russia Fund Inc rose 6-3/8 to 60-1/2, well above a 12-month closing high. The Morgan Stanley Russia & New Europe Fund Inc rose 2-7/8 to 37-7/8, also a 12-month high.
Volume was heavy, with the Morgan Stanley fund showing more than three times normal daily activity by early afternoon. Templeton Russia was trading at five times normal volume.
Templeton Russia was the top percentage gain leader on the New York Stock Exchange in early afternoon. Morgan Stanley's fund was in the No 6 position.
Traders said U.S. interest in Russian stocks had been spurred by the rise in the Russian market, signs of economic reforms and the reduction of taxes on oil companies.
The Russian stock exchange has posted sharp gains in recent weeks. The Russian Trading System index of 22 shares rose by 2.87 percent Wednesday to 503.37.
